name: The Founder
desc: Hinge hips back, reach arms forward and up in a V. Makes your lower back feel like steel.

name: ATG Split Squat
desc: Lunge forward until your hamstring covers your calf. Keeps knees young and hips open.

name: Poliquin Step-Up
desc: Stand on a step. Lower your heel to the floor by only bending your knee. Saves the patella.

name: Tibialis Raise
desc: Back against wall, feet out. Lift your toes toward your shins. The ultimate shin-splint killer.

name: Seated Good Morning
desc: Sit wide. Hinge forward with a flat back until your chest is between your knees. Groin and back health.

name: Nordic Curl (Regressed)
desc: Kneel, feet anchored. Lower yourself as slowly as possible. Bulletproofs the hamstrings.

name: Cat-Cow (Tailbone Only)
desc: Move ONLY your tailbone while keeping the rest of your spine still. Advanced motor control.

name: Bruegger’s Relief Position
desc: Sit at edge of chair. Open arms wide, palms up, tuck chin. The 30-second desk-job antidote.

name: Dead Hang (One Arm)
desc: Hang from the bar with one hand. Switches on the deep stabilizers of the shoulder.

name: Shoulder CARs (Wall-Facing)
desc: Face the wall. Move your arm in a giant circle without touching the wall. Brutal honesty for shoulders.

name: The World’s Greatest Stretch (3 min hold)
desc: Lunge, elbow to instep. Stay there. Breathe. Let the hip capsule actually change shape.

name: Cossack Squat (Weighted)
desc: Hold a weight at chest. Sink deep into a side lunge. Keeps the adductors from snapping.

name: Reverse Plank (Heels Only)
desc: On floor. Push up onto your heels and hands. Strengthens the entire posterior chain.

name: Wall Sit (Heels Elevated)
desc: Wall sit but stay on your toes. Builds 'spring' in the ankles and strengthens the VMO muscle.

name: Passive Spine Extension
desc: Roller under mid-back. Let your head touch the floor. Stay for 2 minutes to reverse the 'slump'.

name: Deep Squat Internal Rotation
desc: In a deep squat, drop one knee inward to the floor. Total hip socket maintenance.

name: The 'Prying' Squat
desc: Hold a KB. In a squat, move side to side, prying the hips open with your elbows.

name: Copenhagen Plank (Short)
desc: Side plank with top knee on a chair. Strengthens the inner thigh/groin connection.

name: Segmental Bridge
desc: Roll your spine up off the floor one inch at a time. Roll down the same way.

name: The 'Old Man' Balance
desc: Put your socks and shoes on while standing on one leg. Don't touch the wall.

name: Quadruped Hip Extension
desc: On all fours. Kick heel to sky without arching your back. Glute isolation for spinal health.

name: Scapular Pull-up (Slow)
desc: Hang. Pull shoulder blades down and together. Hold 3s. Release. Saves the rotator cuff.

name: Wall Slide (With Lift-off)
desc: Arms in W on wall. Slide up. At the top, try to lift your hands off the wall. Hard.

name: Active Pigeon
desc: In pigeon stretch, try to lift your hands and pull your chest up using only your hips.

name: Thoracic Bridge (Slow Flow)
desc: From crab to beast. Reach one arm over and rotate. The ultimate 3D spine mover.

name: Z-Sit Lift
desc: In 90/90 sit, lift your back foot off the floor without leaning. Glute medius fire.

name: Standing Hip Flexor Isometrics
desc: Lift knee above hip height. Push down with your hand while resisting with the leg. Strong hips!

name: The 'Waiters' Walk
desc: Hold a weight straight overhead. Walk for 60 seconds. Teaches the shoulder to stabilize.

name: Face Pull (With External Rotation)
desc: Pull band to face. At the end, rotate hands so they are higher than elbows.

name: Spanish Squat
desc: Band behind knees, anchored. Sit back into a squat. The safest way to load painful knees.

name: T-Spine Opener (Side Lying)
desc: Lie on side, knees tucked. Open your top arm like a book until it touches the floor behind you.

name: Ankle Dorsiflexion (Self-Mobilization)
desc: Band pulls ankle joint back. Drive knee forward. Gaining inches on your squat depth.

name: Wrist Extension (Wall)
desc: Hands flat on wall, fingers up. Slowly slide hands down while keeping palms flat.

name: Wrist Flexion (Wall)
desc: Backs of hands on wall, fingers down. Slowly slide hands up. Fixes 'typing wrists'.

name: Nerve Glide (Median)
desc: Arm out, palm away. Tilt head away, then toward. Flosses the nerves in the arm.

name: Nerve Glide (Ulnar)
desc: Make 'glasses' with fingers over your eyes, elbows out. Feel the stretch in the pinky side.

name: Nerve Glide (Radial)
desc: Arm at side, palm back. Flex wrist, rotate arm inward, tilt head away.

name: Scalene Stretch
desc: Sit on your hand. Tilt head away and slightly back. Breathe into the side of the neck.

name: Jaw Prying
desc: Place tongue on roof of mouth. Open jaw wide. Relieves TMJ tension from stress.

name: Eye Circles
desc: Look as far up, right, down, and left as possible. Your neck mobility is tied to your eyes!

name: Scm Stretch
desc: Rotate head to the side, tilt back. Pull down on your collarbone with your hand.

name: Upper Trap (Active)
desc: Ear to shoulder. Reach opposite hand toward the floor and spread fingers wide.

name: First Rib Mobilization
desc: Towel over shoulder. Pull down while tilting head away. Clears the 'thoracic outlet'.

name: Eagle Arms
desc: Wrap arms around each other, palms together. Lift elbows. Stretches between the blades.

name: Cow Face Arms
desc: One hand over, one under. Try to interlock fingers. The ultimate shoulder test.

name: Child’s Pose (Lat Variation)
desc: In child’s pose, walk your hands to the left. Breathe into the right side.

name: Thread the Needle (Active)
desc: On all fours. Reach one arm through, touch shoulder, then reach that same arm to sky.

name: Kneeling Thoracic Extension
desc: Elbows on chair, hands on neck. Sink chest to floor. Reverses the 'phone hunch'.

name: Seated Spinal Twist
desc: Sit, cross one leg. Hook opposite elbow. Use the chair back to pry yourself around.

name: Windshield Wipers (Lying)
desc: On back, knees bent. Drop knees side to side slowly. Low back lubrication.

name: Happy Baby (Rocking)
desc: On back, grab feet. Rock side to side. Decompresses the sacrum.

name: Deep Squat (10 min total/day)
desc: Accumulate 10 minutes throughout the day in a deep squat. Humans were meant to do this.

name: Single Leg Standing (Eyes Closed)
desc: Stand on one leg. Close your eyes. Hold for 30s. Rewires your balance system.

name: Toe Walking
desc: Walk on your tiptoes for 60 seconds. Strengthens the calves and arches.

name: Heel Walking
desc: Walk on your heels with toes pulled up. Massive shins and ankle stability.

name: Lateral Foot Walking
desc: Walk on the outer edges of your feet. Carefully build ankle roll resistance.

name: Medial Foot Walking
desc: Walk on the inner edges of your feet. Strengthens the medial arch.

name: The 'Pretzel' Stretch
desc: Lie on side. Top leg forward (90 deg), bottom leg back. Grab bottom foot. Rotate.

name: Hip Airplane (Supported)
desc: Hand on wall. Stand on one leg. Tilt your torso and hips open and closed.

name: Curtsy Lunge (Slow)
desc: Slowly step behind and across. Focus on the stretch in the outer hip.

name: Butcher’s Block
desc: Elbows on wall, hands on shoulder blades. Lean in. Best lat/tricep combo stretch.

name: Doorway Pec Stretch (High)
desc: Hands at 135 degrees (Y-shape) on frame. Step through. Hits the lower pec fibers.

name: Doorway Pec Stretch (Low)
desc: Hands at 45 degrees on frame. Step through. Hits the upper pec and bicep.

name: Prone T-Lift
desc: On stomach, arms in T. Lift thumbs to sky, squeezing shoulder blades. Back health.

name: Prone Y-Lift
desc: On stomach, arms in Y. Lift thumbs. Essential for overhead shoulder health.

name: Prone W-Lift
desc: On stomach, arms in W. Squeeze elbows to ribs and lift. Posture king.

name: Scorpion Stretch (Lying)
desc: On stomach, arms in T. Reach one foot across to touch the opposite hand.

name: The 'World’s Greatest' (Spinal variation)
desc: In lunge, reach the inside arm around your front leg and grab your heel.

name: Kneeling Quad Stretch (Wall)
desc: Back knee against wall, shin up the wall. Step other foot forward. Very intense.

name: Shin Box Switch (No Hands)
desc: Rotate knees from side to side without using your hands for support.

name: Seated Pancake (Active)
desc: Sit wide. Reach forward. Try to 'pull' yourself lower using your hip flexors.

name: Frog Stretch (Rocking)
desc: Knees wide. Rock hips back to heels. Exhale as you go back. Open those adductors.

name: Butterfly (Weighted knees)
desc: Butterfly stretch. Use your own arm strength to push knees down. Hold 30s.

name: Lying Glute Stretch
desc: On back, pull one knee to the opposite shoulder. Feel it in the deep glute.

name: Iliacus Release
desc: Ball just inside the hip bone. Lie on it. Don't move. Just breathe for 2 mins.

name: Psoas Smash
desc: Large ball into the gut (carefully). Breathe and let the ball sink into the psoas.

name: Diaphragm Release
desc: Gently hook your fingers under your ribcage. Breathe and lean forward.

name: Lower Trap Floor Slide
desc: On back. Arms at 90. Slide up until they touch, keeping elbows on floor.

name: Prone Swimmers
desc: On stomach. Hands behind head, then reach around to small of back. Don't touch floor.

name: Tabletop Hold
desc: On hands and feet, chest to sky. Lift hips until body is a flat table.

name: Plank to Downward Dog
desc: Flow between these two. Focus on the transition through the shoulders.

name: Side Plank (Hip Dips)
desc: In side plank, touch hip to floor and drive back up. Oblique mobility.

name: Bird-Dog (Square)
desc: Reach opposite arm/leg. Then move them out 45 degrees. Then back. Stability.

name: Dead Bug (Antagonist)
desc: On back. Lower same-side arm and leg. Harder for the brain and core.

name: Bear Crawl (Sideways)
desc: Move like a bear but laterally. Great for shoulder girdle stability.

name: Crab Walk (Backward)
desc: Move in crab position, leading with your head. Opens the chest and shoulders.

name: Gorilla Shuffle
desc: Hands on floor, hop feet around them. Great for hip and wrist prep.

name: Duck Walk (Backward)
desc: Deep squat walking backward. Massive ankle and quad burner.

name: The 'Noodle' Spine
desc: Stand. Move your spine in every possible direction randomly for 60s.

name: Ribcage Circles
desc: Stand. Try to move ONLY your ribcage in a circle. Keep hips still.

name: Hip Circles (Big)
desc: Feet wide. Move hips in the largest circle possible. Think 1950s hula hoop.

name: Neck Nod (Lying)
desc: On back. Lift head 1 inch. Look left, look right. Strengthens deep neck flexors.

name: Tongue Push
desc: Press tongue hard into roof of mouth. Strengthens the support structures of the neck.

name: Finger Splay (Active)
desc: Spread fingers. Try to move only one finger at a time. Brain-body health.

name: Toe Curls
desc: Try to 'walk' across the floor using only your toes. Arch builder.

name: Ankle 8s
desc: Draw a figure 8 with your big toe. Hits every corner of the ankle joint.

name: Standing Pelvic Tilt
desc: Tuck tailbone, then arch back. Move only the pelvis. Foundation of back health.

name: The 'Hanging' Forward Fold
desc: Fold forward, grab elbows. Let gravity stretch your spine for 2 minutes.

name: Seated Neck Tilt
desc: Sit on your hand. Tilt head away. Look up. Look down. Move the stretch.

name: Deep Breath (Rib Expansion)
desc: Hands on side of ribs. Breathe so your hands are pushed out. Lateral breath.
